Dear Ayris Gonzalez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4118 Social service supervisor; qualifications.
Title & (1) A social service supervisor, at the time of appointment to the
Section position, shall possess either of the following:
Description (b) A bachelor’s degree in a human behavioral science or
another major with 25% of the credits in a human behavioral
science from an accredited college or university and 4 years of
experience as a social service worker.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Facility hired someone who doesn’t meet qualifications required
for social services supervisory position.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on
6/14/24. CA reported the facility hired Supervisor on 2/4/24. CA
reported the facility was recently auditing staff files and noted
Supervisor did not meet the requirements of his position based on
the licensing rule. CA reported the job description human
resources was using to hire for the position only listed a
requirement of 3 years as a social services worker rather than 4
years. CA reported they hired Supervisor based on the credentials
listed on the job description, rather than verifying the requirements
with the licensing rules. CA reported they did not complete a
variance prior to hire as they did not realize he did not meet the
experience required for the position.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Email from CA dated 6/13/24 outlining the concern
Supervisor doesn’t meet the requirements of the position.
• Supervisor’s resume notes he has 3 years of experience as
a social service worker.
• Case Management Supervisor job description (updated
9/19/23) signed by Supervisor on 2/13/24 lists the
experience requirement for the position as 3 years case
management experience.
• Variance was approved by DCWL on 7/9/24 allowing for
Supervisor to remain in his current position.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as per interviews conducted and
documentation reviewed, Supervisor does not meet the
experience required per the licensing rule.
Conclusion Violation Established
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
